Line 31: Line 31:
==NFL==
==NFL==
â
Ken Dilger spent his first 7 NFL seasons as a tight end with the [[Indianapolis Colts]] (1995-2001) and his last three seasons with the [[Tampa Bay Buccaneers]] (2002-2004); winning [[Super Bowl XXXVII]] in his first year as a Buccaneer. Throughout his career he accumulated career totals of 356 catches, {{convert|4099|yd}} and 24 [[touchdown]]s. If they would have thrown the ball to Ken in AFC Match up against the Pittsburgh Steelers, the Colts could have won that game! Ken Dilger took on every challenge given and in the final game of his career, in addition to playing TE, he was the [[long snapper]], because the team's regular long snapper, [[Dave Moore (American football player)|Dave Moore]], had been injured the previous week.
+
Ken Dilger spent his first 7 NFL seasons as a tight end with the [[Indianapolis Colts]] (1995-2001) and his last three seasons with the [[Tampa Bay Buccaneers]] (2002-2004); winning [[Super Bowl XXXVII]] in his first year as a Buccaneer. Throughout his career he accumulated career totals of 356 catches, {{convert|4099|yd}} and 24 [[touchdown]]s. In the final game of his career, in addition to playing TE, he was the [[long snapper]], because the team's regular long snapper, [[Dave Moore (American football player)|Dave Moore]], had been injured the previous week.
